examples: He likes to do his car up with blacked-out windows, and all that lollygag.

verbs.description: lollygag (third-person singular simple present lollygags, present participle lollygagging, simple past and past participle lollygagged)

entries.meaning: (US) To dawdle; to be lazy or idle; to avoid necessary work or effort.
examples: Synonyms: dawdle, shirk, slack, procrastinate; see also Thesaurus:shirk

entries.meaning: (US, dated, 19th-20th centuries) To fool around, especially sexually.
examples: Lovemaking and lollygagging are hereby strictly forbidden.  […]  The holding of hands, osculation and constant embracing of WAVES, corpsmen or civilians and sailors or any combination of male and female personnel is a violation of naval discipline.  […]
